title: Graving Dock
description: No photos can be taken at this site since the graving dock is still in use. It is also a National Engineers’ Historic Site. </br></br>‘Graving dock’ is another phrase for ‘dry dock’; to ‘grave’ something is to lay it down. The graving dock survived the explosion, with very little damage. </br></br>The image shows the graving dock just after the explosion. The photograph is from the Nova Scotia Archives, Notman Studio collection.
